141  template <class T>
142  class PerformanceMonitorBase
143  {
144  public:
146  PerformanceMonitorBase(T& counter_in, bool reset=false)
147  : counter_(counter_in), isRecursiveCall_(counter_.isRunning())
148  {
149  (void)reset; // get rid of "unused parameter" warning
150  counter_.incrementNumCalls();
151  }
152 
157  virtual ~PerformanceMonitorBase() {}
158 
169  static RCP<T> getNewCounter(const std::string& name)
170  {
171  RCP<T> rtn = rcp(new T(name), true);
172  counters().append(rtn);
173  return rtn;
174  }
175 
177  static TableFormat& format()
178  {
179  // WARNING This is not thread safe! In particular, if multiple
180  // threads call this method for the "first time" at the same
181  // time, the RCP may be initialized incorrectly.
182  static RCP<TableFormat> rtn=rcp(new TableFormat());
183  return *rtn;
184  }

206  static RCP<T>
207  lookupCounter (const std::string& name);

213  static void clearCounters ();
214 
224  static TEUCHOS_DEPRECATED void clearTimers ();
225 
231  static void clearCounter (const std::string& name);
232 
243  static TEUCHOS_DEPRECATED void clearTimer (const std::string& name);
244 
245  protected:
246 
248  const T& counter() const { return counter_; }
249 
251  T& counter() { return counter_; }
252 
259  bool isRecursiveCall() const { return isRecursiveCall_; }
260 
262  static Array<RCP<T> >& counters()
263  {
264  // Use the "Meyers Trick" to create static data safely.
265  //
266  // WARNING This is not thread safe! In particular, if multiple
267  // threads call counters() for the "first time" at the same
268  // time, the array may be initialized incorrectly.
269  static Array<RCP<T> > rtn;
270  return rtn;
271  }
272 
273  private:
274 
276  T& counter_;
277 
279  bool isRecursiveCall_;
280  };
281 
282 
283  template<class T>
284  RCP<T>
285  PerformanceMonitorBase<T>::lookupCounter (const std::string& name)
286  {
287  Array<RCP<T> >& ctrs = counters();
288 
289  // This will have to change if we change how we store the
290  // counters.
291  for (typename Array<RCP<T> >::const_iterator it = ctrs.begin();
292  it != ctrs.end(); ++it)
293  if ((*it)->name() == name)
294  return *it;
295 
296  return null;
297  }
298 
299  template<class T>
300  void
301  PerformanceMonitorBase<T>::clearCounter (const std::string& name)
302  {
303  Array<RCP<T> > newCounters;
304  // Only fill newCounters with counters whose name is not the given
305  // name to clear. Then, swap newCounters with the old list of
306  // counters.
307  typedef typename Array<RCP<T> >::const_iterator iter_t;
308  for (iter_t it = counters().begin(); it != counters().end(); ++it)
309  {
310  // The variable 'it' is an Array iterator; '*it' is a 'const
311  // RCP<T>&'. We want the latter.
312  if ((*it)->name() != name)
313  newCounters.push_back (*it);
314  }
315  counters().swap (newCounters);
316  }
317 
318  template<class T>
319  void
320  PerformanceMonitorBase<T>::clearTimer (const std::string& name)
321  {
322  clearCounter (name);
323  }
324 
325  template<class T>
326  void
327  PerformanceMonitorBase<T>::clearTimers ()
328  {
329  clearCounters ();
330  }
331 
332  template<class T>
333  void
334  PerformanceMonitorBase<T>::clearCounters ()
335  {
336  // Just resizing an Array to have length zero may not necessarily
337  // free its storage. The standard idiom is to swap with an empty
338  // array.
339  Array<RCP<T> > newCounters;
340  counters().swap (newCounters);
341  }
342 
343 } // namespace Teuchos
